title: Week 1
desc: Although counted as the first week, conception hasn't occurred—your body is gearing up for ovulation.

title: Week 2
desc: Ovulation typically occurs this week, making fertilization possible if sperm is present.

title: Week 3
desc: Fertilization occurs, and the zygote begins rapid cell division as it travels toward uterine implantation.

title: Week 4
desc: The blastocyst implants into the uterine lining and the embryonic stage begins.

title: Week 5
desc: Pregnancy hormones rise, the neural tube forms, and the heart starts beating.

title: Week 6
desc: Limb buds appear, the neural tube closes, and facial features begin forming.

title: Week 7
desc: Major organs continue to develop; heart rate nears 150–170 bpm.

title: Week 8
desc: All major body systems are forming, fingers and toes begin to separate.

title: Week 9
desc: The embryo becomes a fetus; facial features, limbs, and organs continue maturing.

title: Week 10
desc: Toes, fingers, and eyelids are forming, and teeth buds start developing.

title: Week 11
desc: Fetal movements begin internally; bones are forming though still fragile.

title: Week 12
desc: Organs are functioning; miscarriage risk drops significantly after this first trimester milestone.

title: Week 13
desc: Fetus looks more human; skin becomes translucent, fetal movements increase.

title: Week 14
desc: Lanugo (fine hair) starts to form, and facial muscles allow expressions.

title: Week 15
desc: Sex may now be detectable by ultrasound; bones continue hardening.

title: Week 16
desc: Fetus begins sucking motions; most movements still not felt yet.

title: Week 17
desc: Fetal body fat increases and the circulatory system matures.

title: Week 18
desc: Ears and eyes move into position; scans may reveal gender.

title: Week 19
desc: Fetus practices breathing movements; fat stores continue to accumulate.

title: Week 20
desc: Halfway there! You may feel your baby moving; anatomy scan usually done now.

title: Week 21
desc: Baby is about 20cm long; lanugo covers the body; you may feel quickening.

title: Week 22
desc: Fingerprints form, and baby begins storing iron.

title: Week 23
desc: Baby’s movements strengthen; eyelids form and lungs develop.

title: Week 24
desc: Learning taste and voice recognition may begin; skin is wrinkled.

title: Week 25
desc: Muscles strengthen; fat continues to accumulate beneath skin.

title: Week 26
desc: Lungs practice breathing motions; baby responds to sound.

title: Week 27
desc: Entering the third trimester—brain and lungs mature rapidly.

title: Week 28
desc: Eyes open and close; rapid brain development continues.

title: Week 29
desc: Muscle mass increases; bones are fully developed but soft.

title: Week 30
desc: Baby gains around half a pound per week; immune system strengthens.

title: Week 31
desc: Lanugo begins to shed; baby’s position may shift head-down.

title: Week 32
desc: Bones harden; lanugo nearly gone; baby continues growing steadily.

title: Week 33
desc: Baby's lungs mature quickly; fat increases and hearing sharpens.

title: Week 34
desc: Baby drops lower; digestive system completes development.

title: Week 35
desc: Baby gains strength and weight; bones are fully developed.

title: Week 36
desc: Lanugo is mostly gone; baby may engage deeper into birth canal.

title: Week 37
desc: Full term! Baby’s organs are ready; final growth and fat accumulation.

title: Week 38
desc: Baby practices breathing and movements inside; growth continues steadily.

title: Week 39
desc: Baby is ready for birth; lanugo gone, lungs fully mature.

title: Week 40
desc: Due date arrives! Baby may arrive any time now as most reach full term.
